247 - 16 Dec 2023 08:15PM - +263 78 896 1515: Greetings everyone! My story is based on a street kid named Nhamoinesu .   Once upon a time in the bustling city of Harare , there lived a young boy named Nhamo. Nhamo was a street kid, born and raised on the unforgiving streets of the city. Despite his difficult circumstances, Nhamo possessed a heart full of determination and a spirit that refused to be broken.  Every day, Nhamo woke up with the rising sun, ready to face the challenges that lay ahead. He would scavenge for scraps of food, relying on his quick wit and nimble fingers to find his next meal. Nhamo knew the value of hard work, and he never shied away from any opportunity to make an honest living.  One fateful day, as Nhamo was rummaging through a garbage dump, he stumbled upon a worn-out leather jacket. Intrigued by its mysterious allure, Nhamo decided to investigate further. To his surprise, hidden inside one of the jacket's pockets was a crumpled piece of paper. It was a map‚Äîa map that promised untold riches buried deep within the heart of the city.  Driven by a newfound sense of hope, Nhamo set out on an adventure like no other. He followed the map's intricate paths, navigating through the bustling streets, dark alleys, and hidden corners of the city. Along the way, he encountered various obstacles and met a cast of colorful characters, each with their own stories of struggle and perseverance.  As Nhamo delved deeper into the heart of the city, he discovered that the treasure the map led him to wasn't material wealth, but something far more valuable‚Äîfriendship, love, and a sense of belonging. Through his encounters, Nhamo learned the power of compassion, empathy, and the importance of standing up for what is right.  With every step he took, Nhamo's reputation as a street kid changed. People began to recognize his integrity, his diligence, and his unwavering honesty. Nhamo's journey not only transformed his own life, but it also inspired those around him to reevaluate their own values and priorities.  In the end, Nhamo's journey led him back to where he started‚Äîthe streets of Harare. But this time, he wasn't alone. Nhamo had formed a tight-knit community of street kids, bound by their shared experiences and united in their pursuit of a better future. Together, they worked tirelessly to create a world where every child had a chance to thrive, regardless of their circumstances.  Nhamo's story became legendary, passed down through generations as a reminder of the power of honesty and hard work. His name became synonymous with integrity, and his legacy echoed through the city's streets.  And so, the tale of Nhamo, the street kid, serves as a timeless reminder that no matter where we come from or what challenges we face, with honesty, integrity, and diligence, we can overcome any obstacle and create a world where dreams become reality.

562 - 16 Dec 2023 06:23PM - +91 76268 84388: Since it‚Äôs going yo be Christmas soon I decided to write something about my experience from the last Christmas when I was with my family.  The Christmas ü§∂  It was a cold and snowy night on December 24th, 2023. I was sitting in the living room with my parents and my little brother ,watching a classic Christmas movie on TV. We had just finished decorating the tree and wrapping the presents, and we were feeling cozy and festive.  Suddenly, we heard a loud knock on the door. We wondered who it could be, since we were not expecting any visitors. My dad got up and opened the door, and we saw a familiar face standing outside. It was my uncle Ansy ,who had moved to Canada a few years ago. We had not seen him in a long time, and we were overjoyed to see him.  "Surprise!" he exclaimed, holding a big suitcase and a smile. "I decided to come home for Christmas and spend some time with you guys. I hope you don't mind."  "Of course not!" my mom said, hugging him warmly. "We are so happy to see you. Come in, come in. You must be freezing."  We all welcomed him into our house, and he joined us in the living room. He told us that he had booked a flight a few days ago, and he wanted to surprise us. He said that he missed us a lot, and he wanted to celebrate Christmas with his family. He also brought some gifts for us, which he had bought in Canada.  We were so touched by his gesture, and we thanked him for his generosity. We spent the next few hours catching up with him, and listening to his stories about his life in Canada. He told us about his job, his friends, and his adventures. He also showed us some pictures and videos on his phone. He seemed happy and successful, and we were proud of him.  We also shared our news and updates with him, and he was interested and supportive. He praised my sister for her good grades, and he congratulated me for winning a poetry contest. He also complimented my parents for their hard work and dedication. He said that he was glad that we were doing well, and he hoped that we would always be happy.  We had a lot of fun talking and laughing with him, and we felt a strong bond of love and affection. We realized how much we had missed him, and how much he meant to us. He was not just our uncle, he was our friend and our mentor.  We decided to have a late dinner together, and my mom cooked some delicious dishes for us. We enjoyed the food and the company, and we toasted to our family and our friendship. We also exchanged our gifts, and we were delighted with what we received. My uncle gave me a book of poems by a famous Canadian poet, and he gave my sister a pair of earrings that he had made himself. He gave my parents a beautiful painting of a snowy landscape, and he said that it reminded him of our home.  We thanked him for his thoughtful and creative gifts, and we gave him our gifts as well. We had bought him a sweater with the Indian flag on it, and we had made him a photo album with some of our favorite memories. He was moved by our gifts, and he said that he loved them. He said that he would always cherish them, and he would always remember us.  We hugged him and told him that we loved him too, and we would always miss him. We wished him a merry Christmas, and he wished us the same. We then settled down on the couch, and we watched the rest of the movie together. We felt warm and cozy, and we felt a sense of peace and joy. We knew that we had just experienced a wonderful Christmas miracle, and we were grateful for it.

250 - 09 Dec 2023 07:03PM - Saloni Edoofa: Hello My Proud Edoofian,  I hope this message finds you well. Today's Saturday activity is designed to help us get familiar with Microsoft Excel, a powerful tool for data organization and analysis. We'll begin with a simple yet practical exercise: creating a Weekly Activity Log and Time Tracker.  Activity Instructions:  Open Microsoft Excel:  Launch Microsoft Excel on your computer or phone. If you don't have it installed, you can use any spreadsheet software available to you. Set Up Columns:  Create three columns with the following headers: "Activity," "Day of the Week," and "Time Spent (in minutes)." Record Your Activities:  Think about the activities you engaged in during the past week, such as studying, exercising, or socializing. In the "Activity" column, list each activity separately. Specify Days:  In the "Day of the Week" column, record the corresponding day for each activity. Log Time:  In the "Time Spent" column, record the amount of time (in minutes) you spent on each activity. Calculate Average Time:  Utilize Excel functions to calculate the average time spent per activity and the overall average time for the week. Reflect:  In a designated area, jot down a brief reflection on your insights from tracking activities and time spent. Save and Submit:  Save the file with an appropriate name (e.g., "WeeklyActivityLog_YourName.xlsx"). Submit the completed spreadsheet following the instructions provided.  Remember, this activity serves as an introduction to Microsoft Excel, and we'll build on these skills in future sessions. Feel free to reach out if you encounter any challenges during the activity.  Let's dive in and make the most of today's exploration of Excel!  Best regards, Ms. Saloni

93 - 16 Dec 2023 12:51PM - Arshita: *Bachelor of Commerce (B.com)* is a three year long undergraduate course that is evenly distributed into 6 half-yearly semesters.  A high number of jobs are available for B.com graduates in industries such as Information Technology, Manufacturing, Telecommunications and Banking.The most sought after B.Com. jobs are Financial Manger, Accountant, Lecturer, Chartered Accountant, Human Resource Development etc.  The 3 year B.com degree program aims to facilitate a deep understanding of how business organizations work. It develops knowledge and skills in core B.com subjects like Accounting, Finance, Banking & Insurance, Marketing, Human Resources and Taxation. The entire B.com syllabus is designed in a manner which develops competency in students, allowing them to pursue higher level programs. It also increases practical knowledge and employability.  The subjects included in B.com program are as following:  *Accountancy* *Cost Account* *Statistics* *Management* *Human Resource* *Computer* *Economics* *English* *Law* *Marketing* *Finance*   After being awarded the B.Com degree, candidates can either look for jobs in various departments or opt for higher education.  *B.Com graduates can pursue post-graduation courses such as M.Com (Master of Commerce), MBA (Master of Business Administration), CA (Chartered Accountant), CS (Company Secretary), Actuarial Scientist, and ACCA (Association of Chartered Accountants).*  *B.Com graduates have a plethora of job positions in government as well as private sectors to choose from provided that they are not limited to careers in accounts and finance*

217 - 16 Dec 2023 03:02PM - Austin: Early financial planning for tertiary education is crucial for parents for several reasons:  *Cost of Education:* Tertiary education, including college or university, can be expensive. Tuition fees, books, accommodation, and other associated costs can add up significantly. Planning allows parents to save and budget for these expenses, reducing the financial burden when the time comes.  *Time Horizon:* Tertiary education typically takes several years to complete. By starting to save early, parents have a longer time horizon to accumulate the necessary funds.  *Financial Stability:* By planning early, parents can avoid financial stress and debt. Without proper planning, they may have to rely on loans or other high-cost financing options, which can lead to long-term financial challenges. SAVE YOURSELF FROM LOANS  *INTERNSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK:* Early planning can also involve students participating in projects that will be offered by the EWYL Department of Edoofa after Induction which can help offset the cost of education. These opportunities often have application deadlines, so planning allows parents to take advantage of them.  *Teach Financial Responsibility:* Involving children in the financial planning process can teach them valuable lessons about money management, savings, and responsibility. It helps instill good financial habits from an early age.  *Avoiding Last-Minute Rush:* Delaying financial planning until the last minute can lead to rushed decisions and inadequate savings. Early planning provides a more thoughtful and organized approach.  *Goal Setting:* Setting specific financial goals for education allows parents to track their progress and adjust their savings strategies as needed. It provides a clear roadmap for achieving the desired educational outcomes.  *Peace of Mind:* Knowing that you have a financial plan in place for your child's education can provide peace of mind. It reduces uncertainty and allows parents to focus on other aspects of their child's development without constant worry about funding education.   In conclusion, early financial planning for tertiary education is essential for parents to ensure that they can provide their children with quality education without compromising their own financial stability. It allows for more effective financial management and better opportunities for both parents and students.
218 - 16 Dec 2023 03:11PM - +27 78 760 0842: Alright. Thank you so much.
219 - 16 Dec 2023 03:35PM - Austin: You are most welcome
220 - 16 Dec 2023 03:38PM - Austin: As you know, students are currently occupied with lessons and exams due to which they are unavailable now. At the same time, the day scholars in Malawi are still applying and clearing the tests.  All these factors have been a disadvantage for the boarding students and specifically the students who aren't supposed to use their devices in School. 217 - 16 Dec 2023 03:02PM - Austin: Early financial planning for tertiary education is crucial for parents for several reasons:  *Cost of Education:* Tertiary education, including college or university, can be expensive. Tuition fees, books, accommodation, and other associated costs can add up significantly. Planning allows parents to save and budget for these expenses, reducing the financial burden when the time comes.  *Time Horizon:* Tertiary education typically takes several years to complete. By starting to save early, parents have a longer time horizon to accumulate the necessary funds.  *Financial Stability:* By planning early, parents can avoid financial stress and debt. Without proper planning, they may have to rely on loans or other high-cost financing options, which can lead to long-term financial challenges. SAVE YOURSELF FROM LOANS  *INTERNSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK:* Early planning can also involve students participating in projects that will be offered by the EWYL Department of Edoofa after Induction which can help offset the cost of education. These opportunities often have application deadlines, so planning allows parents to take advantage of them.  *Teach Financial Responsibility:* Involving children in the financial planning process can teach them valuable lessons about money management, savings, and responsibility. It helps instill good financial habits from an early age.  *Avoiding Last-Minute Rush:* Delaying financial planning until the last minute can lead to rushed decisions and inadequate savings. Early planning provides a more thoughtful and organized approach.  *Goal Setting:* Setting specific financial goals for education allows parents to track their progress and adjust their savings strategies as needed. It provides a clear roadmap for achieving the desired educational outcomes.  *Peace of Mind:* Knowing that you have a financial plan in place for your child's education can provide peace of mind. It reduces uncertainty and allows parents to focus on other aspects of their child's development without constant worry about funding education.   In conclusion, early financial planning for tertiary education is essential for parents to ensure that they can provide their children with quality education without compromising their own financial stability. It allows for more effective financial management and better opportunities for both parents and students.

61 - 16 Dec 2023 01:50PM - Harmehak: Actually you are mistaken over here, let me explain to you that there are two kinds of programs that provide assistance to the students because a lot of times parents and students themselves misunderstand what a Scholarship actually means.  *1. Scholarships* *2. Sponsorships*  Scholarships make education *affordable* for the students by reducing their *Tuition Fees*, now a lot of times parents and students consider that a Domestic Scholarship would be the same as an International Scholarship, but to understand the difference between them, consider yourself applying for an education in your own country with the help of a scholarship. Now after the scholarship when your tuition fee would be reduced, eventually your entire cost of education would be reduced because being a citizen of the country, you wouldn't be required to spend any fees on Accommodation and feeding separately since in that case, students would be staying with their families. However, if I personally plan to study in Zimbabwe with the same scholarship, I would have to incur some costs on Accommodation and Feeding because I am not a Zimbabwean Citizen. So a lot of times parents and students consider International Scholarship and Domestic Scholarship one and the same thing, but in reality, they aren't.  Sponsorships, on the other hand, take care entirely of a student's education, but because Sponsorships are provided by only a few organizations, there are a lot of terms and conditions which a student might need to follow in order to get the sponsorship, the most common term is that a student after completion of the course would have to work for the organization providing the sponsorship for a period of time.

Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. When a student plans to apply for a university abroad, the following requirements are typically involved:  1) *Application Form*: This is a formal document where students provide their personal and academic information, including educational background, achievements, and contact details.  2) *Statement of Purpose*: Often required for graduate school applications, this essay highlights the student's motivations, goals, academic interests, and how they align with the chosen program or university. It helps the admission committee in assessing the applicant's suitability.  3) *Letter(s) of Recommendation*: These letters are written by senior authorities, such as professors, employers, or academic advisors, who can attest to the student's capabilities, skills, and suitability for higher education. These recommendations add credibility to the application.  These three components - application form, statement of purpose, and letter of recommendation - are typically crucial parts of the application package when applying to a university abroad.

313 - 16 Dec 2023 06:03PM - Sahil Edoofa: Okay so basically you see in the first mode, the Direct Bank Transfer Mode, the transfer charges which are to be borne by the parents of the student ranges between $100 to $120 which become quite high for a lot of parents considering the economic situation in Zimbabwe itself. So as not every student is in a position to cater for an additional $100 to $120 just as transfer charge, the second mode was introduced, wherein, it is the Bank deposit in Mr. Charles's Account, in this the transfer charges get divided amongst 10 students resulting in an equivalent bearing of 12.5% at the end.  So as you can see in the letter that there is a Bank deposit in, Mr. Charles Jerera (Retired Education Officer)'s account as he is our Associated Partner there in Zimbabwe, Since 2020 there have been over 1400+ students who have been assisted by Mr Charles inorder to complete their enrollment formalities as well as university fee payments after arriving in India.

I wish to draw your attention to the fascinating parallels between Indian and Zimbabwean cuisines, underscoring the shared elements that reflect a delightful convergence of culinary traditions. Despite the geographical expanse that separates our cultures, both Indian and Zimbabwean culinary landscapes celebrate a rich tapestry of flavors. The use of aromatic spices, the incorporation of fresh and seasonal ingredients, and a reverence for communal dining are notable commonalities. From foundational staples such as rice and bread to the diverse array of vegetables and meats, the similarities in essence are unmistakable. While each culture exhibits its unique spice palette and culinary techniques, the fundamental spirit of uniting people through delightful and nourishing meals is a shared value. Exploring the nuances of Indian cuisine may offer a profound appreciation for the cultural resonance it shares with Zimbabwean gastronomy!

A student of psychology has to study how a human mind works in different situations, how it develops perception, what are the various circumstances and how they affect the development of human behavior. Although psychology is introduced at school level in India, it is only at the college level when one learns the basic theories and applications related to Psychology and Psychoanalysis. Psychology courses at the undergraduate level are generally application based and prepare students for entry level jobs in related fields.  BA Psychology is ideal for students who have a leaning towards Arts and Social Sciences and are willing to take up an in-depth study of psychology.  *Career Prospects*  What can you do with a BA degree in Psychology?  The graduates of BA Psychology have a lot of opportunities ahead, both in academics and in the job sector.  *Jobs*  The graduates of this course get various opportunities to work in many different fields in both the private sector and the government sector. Title: Life in Rwanda 16 Years After the Genocide  The genocide in Rwanda in 1994 had a profound impact on the country, leading to widespread devastation and loss. Sixteen years after the genocide, Rwanda has undergone significant changes in various aspects of life. This assignment aims to explore and analyze the current state of life in Rwanda, focusing on social, economic, and political aspects Social Reconciliation and Healing.Initiatives and programs promoting unity and reconciliation.Challenges and progress in addressing trauma and social integration.Economic Development and Stability.Growth and development in key economic sectors.Efforts to improve living standards and reduce poverty.Political Landscape and Governance.Government initiatives to promote stability and democracy.International relations and Rwanda's position in the global community.Rwanda has made significant strides in rebuilding and transforming the country 16 years after the genocide. While challenges remain, the progress in social reconciliation, economic development, and political stability reflects the resilience and determination of the Rwandan people. Ongoing efforts are crucial to address remaining issues and continue the path towards a brighter future for Rwanda.  SECTION 6 PERSONALITY TEST "My Inspirational Story"  Chantell, a determined and compassionate A-level student at Oasis College, embarked on a journey of self-discovery through a personality test. As she delved into the depths of her strengths and aspirations, she uncovered a profound sense of purpose and potential within herself.  The personality test revealed that Chantell possessed a natural inclination towards leadership and a deep-seated passion for social justice. Armed with this newfound self-awareness, Chantell sought out opportunities to channel her strengths and make a positive impact in her community.  Driven by her desire to lead and inspire change, Chantell took on the role of student council president at Oasis College. Through her leadership, she spearheaded initiatives to promote inclusivity, mental health awareness, and environmental sustainability within the college campus. Her unwavering dedication and ability to rally her peers around important causes earned her the respect and admiration of both students and faculty.  As Chantell continued to explore her potential, she discovered a love for public speaking and advocacy. She used her platform as a student leader to raise awareness about social issues, delivering powerful speeches that resonated with her peers and sparked meaningful conversations. Her ability to articulate her vision for a more equitable and compassionate society inspired others to join her in creating positive change.  Outside of her academic pursuits, Chantell volunteered at local community organizations, dedicating her time to mentorship programs for underprivileged youth and advocating for educational equity. Her empathetic nature and genuine desire to uplift others made a tangible difference in the lives of those she touched.  Chantell's journey through the personality test not only provided her with valuable insights into her own strengths and passions but also ignited a fire within her to pursue a path of purpose-driven leadership and advocacy. Her story serves as an inspiration to her peers, demonstrating the transformative power of self-discovery and the profound impact that one individual can have on the world.  As Chantell continues to navigate her academic journey and beyond, she remains committed to leveraging her strengths and passions to create a more just and compassionate society. Her story is a testament to the potential that lies within each individual to effect positive change and leave a lasting legacy of inspiration and empowerment.  *The examiner will use your composition to analyze your personality traits. USE AT LEAST 400 WORDS.*   All the best for your Scholarship Test.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Title: Life in Rwanda 16 Years After the Genocide  The genocide in Rwanda in 1994 had a profound impact on the country, leading to widespread devastation and loss. Sixteen years after the genocide, Rwanda has undergone significant changes in various aspects of life. This assignment aims to explore and analyze the current state of life in Rwanda, focusing on social, economic, and political aspects Social Reconciliation and Healing.Initiatives and programs promoting unity and reconciliation.Challenges and progress in addressing trauma and social integration.Economic Development and Stability.Growth and development in key economic sectors.Efforts to improve living standards and reduce poverty.Political Landscape and Governance.Government initiatives to promote stability and democracy.International relations and Rwanda's position in the global community.Rwanda has made significant strides in rebuilding and transforming the country 16 years after the genocide. While challenges remain, the progress in social reconciliation, economic development, and political stability reflects the resilience and determination of the Rwandan people. Ongoing efforts are crucial to address remaining issues and continue the path towards a brighter future for Rwanda.  SECTION 6 PERSONALITY TEST "My Inspirational Story"  Chantell, a determined and compassionate A-level student at Oasis College, embarked on a journey of self-discovery through a personality test. As she delved into the depths of her strengths and aspirations, she uncovered a profound sense of purpose and potential within herself.  The personality test revealed that Chantell possessed a natural inclination towards leadership and a deep-seated passion for social justice. Armed with this newfound self-awareness, Chantell sought out opportunities to channel her strengths and make a positive impact in her community.  Driven by her desire to lead and inspire change, Chantell took on the role of student council president at Oasis College. Through her leadership, she spearheaded initiatives to promote inclusivity, mental health awareness, and environmental sustainability within the college campus. Her unwavering dedication and ability to rally her peers around important causes earned her the respect and admiration of both students and faculty.  As Chantell continued to explore her potential, she discovered a love for public speaking and advocacy. She used her platform as a student leader to raise awareness about social issues, delivering powerful speeches that resonated with her peers and sparked meaningful conversations. Her ability to articulate her vision for a more equitable and compassionate society inspired others to join her in creating positive change.  Outside of her academic pursuits, Chantell volunteered at local community organizations, dedicating her time to mentorship programs for underprivileged youth and advocating for educational equity. Her empathetic nature and genuine desire to uplift others made a tangible difference in the lives of those she touched.  Chantell's journey through the personality test not only provided her with valuable insights into her own strengths and passions but also ignited a fire within her to pursue a path of purpose-driven leadership and advocacy. Her story serves as an inspiration to her peers, demonstrating the transformative power of self-discovery and the profound impact that one individual can have on the world.  As Chantell continues to navigate her academic journey and beyond, she remains committed to leveraging her strengths and passions to create a more just and compassionate society. Her story is a testament to the potential that lies within each individual to effect positive change and leave a lasting legacy of inspiration and empowerment.  *The examiner will use your composition to analyze your personality traits. 133 - 15 Dec 2023 02:51PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Bachelor of Pharmacy(B.Pharm.)* is a 4 year undergraduate program which is compulsory for anyone who wants to practice as a pharmacist. B. Pharmacy is study of preparing and conferring drugs and medicines for a number of illnesses and deficiencies.  Pharmacists are needed in every location and every hospital, due to which the scope of this course has increased positively. The program has been bringing out healthcare professionals from a long time and would continue to do so for years to come as the field is growing at a fast pace.  *Bachelor of Pharmacy: What is it about?*  Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharma) covers all the facets of healthcare including bio-chemical areas that concern the preparation of medicines and implementing those for the right diagnose. Prevailing modernization in the field of Pharmacy has globally increased its value. Bachelor of Pharmacy engages studies of all those subjects that therapeutically help people provided from their medicines.  The course is versatile and dynamic as it offers jobs in various fields like R & D, Manufacturing, Quality Control, packaging and much more.   B. Pharmacy is all about maintaining a standardized quality of people‚Äôs health and living. As a student of B. Pharmacy, you learn about the medicines and their effect on the human body, with details of the chemical and organic properties of all the elements used.  The program teaches students how to become attentive professionals so as to ensure selection of a right drug for the right treatment for which all topics of pharmacology, chemistry, pharmaceutical chemistry, biochemistry, kinetics, pharmacy management, and compounding medications are covered.  *Bachelor of Pharmacy: Who should opt?*  Students who are willing to work around medicines and have a good attitude towards the pharma industry can opt for this course. This course is also ideal for people who wish to open or own a chemist shop and have strong business skills can also opt for B. Pharmacy. With a degree of Bachelor of Pharmacy, a student can register with the State Pharmacy Council and open their own Chemist shop to stock and sell medicines.  The course offers job opportunities in both public as well private sectors that allows students to make a valuable career in this field.Students can even opt for teaching job in this field, if they are willing to become a lecturer. There are different practice environments in this field, some of which are:  *Hospital Pharmacy* *Clinical Pharmacy* *Technical Pharmacy* *Research Agencies* *Medical Dispensing Store* *Food and Drug Administration* *Sales and Marketing Department* *Educational Institutes* *Health Centres*

135 - 16 Dec 2023 12:07PM - Shubham Madhwal: Let me explain why Edoofa recommends India as a destination for higher study. You see over the past 6 years, the Edoofa Scholarship Program is only focused in India, because of the following reasons:  1. *Robust Education System:* India boasts the world's third-largest education system, comprising 1000+ universities and 39,931 colleges. This extensive infrastructure provides students with a diverse range of educational opportunities.  2. *Renowned Institutions:* India is home to highly rated institutions known for their academic excellence and quality of education. Students can choose from a wide range of disciplines, including politics, philosophy, engineering, medical sciences, biology, business, and media/journalism.  3. *Quality Education and Research:* Indian universities emphasize a rigorous academic curriculum that combines theoretical knowledge with practical skill development. Students have opportunities for cutting-edge research projects and collaboration with experts.  4. *Faculty Expertise:* The faculty members in Indian institutions are highly qualified and bring industry expertise to the classroom. They provide quality instruction, mentorship, and guidance to nurture students' academic and professional growth.  5. *Global Recognition and Career Prospects:* Indian degrees are globally recognized, opening doors to a wide range of career opportunities worldwide. Graduates from Indian institutions have achieved success in various fields globally.  6. *Cultural Diversity and Vibrant Campus Life:* India's educational institutions celebrate cultural diversity, providing students with a multicultural environment. Additionally, students can engage in vibrant campus life, participate in cultural festivals, and experience the rich heritage of India.  7. *Affordability and Scholarships:* Studying in India is more affordable compared to many renowned institutions worldwide. The cost of education is lower, and various scholarships, loans, and financial assistance programs are available to support students.  8. *English Medium of Instruction:* English is widely used as a medium of instruction in Indian universities, ensuring a comfortable learning experience for international students.  9. *Research and Innovation Opportunities:* Indian institutions offer opportunities for students to engage in cutting-edge research and innovation. They can collaborate with experts, contribute to advancements in their fields, and develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.  Let me also show you some facts about India and several global leaders who are Indian graduates.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The title that best suits the passage would be: a) The Change of Nature b) The Will to Fight c) Courage and Panic d) The Miracle of Confronting Danger  2.A man may react to sudden danger in three different ways . What are they? a) He may be paralyzed with fear, run away or fight. b) He may flee in panic, or fight back or stand still. c) He may be paralyzed with fear, or seized with panic, or as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, and face the danger. d) He may be paralyzed with fear, seized with panic or act like an inferior animal.  3.What is the meaning of the word debilitating ? a) enfeeble b) thriving c) strengthen d) debase  4. Explain the phrase ‚Äògather resolution from danger‚Äô. a) Find peace in times of difficulty. b) To remain calm and not to lose hope. c) A state of utter hopelessness makes one determined to face the difficulty. d) To be enthusiastic and brave the odds.  5. The author feels happy in the recollection of dangers faced and overcome because a) He felt elated as he was alive. b) They added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time. c) They brought him a new experience. d) These experiences boosted his confidence. Whey to Go Greek yogurt‚Äîa strained form of cultured yogurt‚Äîhas grown enormously in popularity in the United States since it was first introduced in the country in the late 1980s. From 2011 to 2012 alone, sales of Greek yogurt in the US increased by 50 percent. The resulting increase in Greek yogurt production has forced those involved in the business to address the detrimental effects that the yogurt-making process may be having on the environment. Fortunately, farmers and others in the Greek yogurt business have found many methods of controlling and eliminating most environmental threats. Given these solutions as well as the many health benefits of the food, the advantages of Greek yogurt Q5. outdo the potential drawbacks of its production.Sentence [1] The main environmental problem caused by the production of Greek yogurt is the creation of acid whey as a by-product.Sentence [2] Because it requires up to four times more milk to make than conventional yogurt does, Greek yogurt produces larger amounts of acid whey, which is difficult to dispose of.Sentence [3] To address the problem of disposal, farmers have found a number of uses for acid whey. Therefore, the correct answer is B) 2.  Section 5  Life in Rwanda 16 years after the genocide has seen significant progress in various aspects. The genocide in 1994 left the country devastated, with millions of people dead, communities shattered, and infrastructure destroyed. However, through resilience, unity, and determined efforts, Rwanda has managed to rebuild itself and create a better future for its citizens.  One of the most remarkable aspects of life in Rwanda today is the unity and reconciliation that has been fostered among its people. After the genocide, the government implemented a comprehensive plan to promote national unity and healing. The Gacaca courts were established to hold community-based trials, allowing both victims and perpetrators to come together, share their stories, and seek forgiveness. Through these efforts, Rwanda has managed to restore a sense of trust and social cohesion among its citizens.  Furthermore, Rwanda has made significant progress in terms of economic development. The government has implemented various initiatives to promote entrepreneurship, attract foreign investment, and diversify the economy. As a result, Rwanda has experienced steady economic growth over the past decade, with an average GDP growth rate of around 8% per year. This has led to a reduction in poverty rates and an improvement in living standards for many Rwandans.  Education is another area where Rwanda has made significant strides. The government has prioritized education as a means to build a knowledge-based society and create opportunities for its citizens. Today, primary school enrollment rates are close to 100%, and the government has made efforts to increase access to secondary and tertiary education as well. This focus on education has not only empowered individuals but also contributed to the overall development of the country.  In terms of infrastructure development, Rwanda has made impressive achievements. The government has invested heavily in building roads, bridges, and other transportation networks, connecting previously isolated regions and improving access to markets. Additionally, the country has embraced technology and innovation, positioning itself as a hub for tech startups and digital services. These advancements have not only improved the quality of life for Rwandans but have also attracted international attention and investment.  Despite these positive developments, challenges still remain. The scars of the genocide continue to linger, and there is a need for ongoing healing and reconciliation efforts. Furthermore, while poverty rates have decreased, income inequality remains a pressing issue. The government must continue to address these challenges to ensure a more equitable and inclusive society.  In conclusion, life in Rwanda 16 years after the genocide has witnessed remarkable progress. Through unity, reconciliation, and determined efforts, the country has managed to rebuild itself and create a better future for its citizens. Rwanda's achievements in economic development, education, and infrastructure are commendable. However, challenges persist, and the government must continue to address them to ensure a more inclusive and prosperous society. Despite the challenges, Rwanda serves as an inspiring example of resilience and the power of collective healing.   Section 6  Life often throws unexpected challenges our way, testing our resilience and determination. My journey has been no exception, as I have faced numerous obstacles while striving to achieve my goals. However, it is through these trials that I have discovered my true strength and learned valuable lessons that have shaped me into the person I am today.  From a young age, I knew that I wanted to make a difference in the world of technology. However, coming from a humble background and lacking the resources and opportunities that others may have had, I had to carve my own path. I worked tirelessly to educate myself, devouring books, online courses, and any available resources to expand my knowledge.  In the pursuit of success, failure is inevitable. Instead of letting setbacks discourage me, I viewed them as valuable learning experiences. Each failure taught me a new lesson and fueled my determination to succeed. It was through this mindset that I developed resilience and a growth mindset, understanding that failure is not the end but a stepping stone towards success.  No journey can be completed alone. Recognizing this, I actively sought out mentors who could guide and inspire me. Their wisdom and guidance proved invaluable, helping me navigate the complex world of technology. Additionally, I surrounded myself with peers who shared similar goals and aspirations, creating a supportive network that uplifted and motivated each other.  Obstacles are bound to arise on any journey, and my path was no exception. Financial constraints, self-doubt, and societal expectations often threatened to derail my progress. However, I refused to succumb to these challenges. Instead, I dug deep within myself, reminding myself of my passion and the impact I wanted to make. This unwavering commitment to my vision fueled my perseverance and propelled me forward.  As I started achieving my own goals, I realized the importance of giving back and empowering others. I became involved in initiatives that aimed to bridge the digital divide, providing access to technology and education for underprivileged communities. By sharing my knowledge and resources, I hope to inspire others and create a more inclusive and equitable future.  My journey has been a testament to the power of resilience, determination, and the belief in oneself. While the road has been challenging, it has also been incredibly rewarding. Each obstacle I overcame, each failure I experienced, and each person I helped along the way has shaped me into the person I am today. I am proud of my journey, and I am grateful for the lessons I have learned. I am confident that these experiences will continue to guide me as I strive to make a lasting impact in the world of technology.

If you have any doubts regarding the test or any information, you can ask without hesitation. --------------------------------------------------------  SECTION 1:- PERSONAL INFORMATION  Name as per School Record- Gender- Date of Birth as per School Record- Father's Name- Mother's Name- Email Address- Parent's email address- Course: Intake Year: Country :   SECTION 2 READING TEST  Questions 1-5 are based on the following passage. If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The title that best suits the passage would be: a) The Change of Nature b) The Will to Fight c) Courage and Panic d) The Miracle of Confronting Danger  2.A man may react to sudden danger in three different ways . What are they? a) He may be paralyzed with fear, run away or fight. b) He may flee in panic, or fight back or stand still. c) He may be paralyzed with fear, or seized with panic, or as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, and face the danger. d) He may be paralyzed with fear, seized with panic or act like an inferior animal.  3.What is the meaning of the word debilitating ? a) enfeeble b) thriving c) strengthen d) debase  4. Explain the phrase ‚Äògather resolution from danger‚Äô. a) Find peace in times of difficulty. b) To remain calm and not to lose hope. c) A state of utter hopelessness makes one determined to face the difficulty. d) To be enthusiastic and brave the odds.  5. The author feels happy in the recollection of dangers faced and overcome because a) He felt elated as he was alive. b) They added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time. c) They brought him a new experience. d) These experiences boosted his confidence. The resulting increase in Greek yogurt production has forced those involved in the business to address the detrimental effects that the yogurt-making process may be having on the environment. Basically, this registration fee will be waived off from your First Year's Fee and after that, *the remaining annual fee has to be paid after coming to India in 2 instalments*. The first part will be paid in August (2024- 2025) and the remaining in January next year (2025-2026).  3. The Annual fee after the scholarship as discussed above would be between $2000-$3000, and this would include Accommodation, Food Expenses and Basic University Expenses such as exam fee, Library Fee, Lab Fee

97 - 16 Dec 2023 10:34AM - Tushti: *Physiotherapy* is a branch of healthcare that applies modes of physical movement such as exercise, massage, besides education, advice, and counselling services to circumstances where movement and function are threatened by ageing, pain, injury, diseases, disorders, conditions, or other environmental factors.  Students enrolled to the course are taught on an advanced level about core physiotherapeutic skills such as manual therapy, therapeutic exercises, and application of electro-physical modalities, which have been proven to cure a range of disabilities and disease related to spine, back, neck, and even stress-related incontinence.  Bachelor of Physiotherapy is a 4-year undergraduate course, including compulsory 6 months of clinical internship, and involving the science of physical movement aimed at preventing disease and disability.  The opportunities for a career in Physiotherapy are excellent, whether in the public health system, private practice or non-government organisations. Career pathways include the disciplines and areas of:  *Healthcare Management* *Industrial Rehabilitation* *Research & Academics* *Special Schools* *Multinational companies for fitness of their employers*

132 - 16 Dec 2023 01:22PM - Tushti: Alright, let me brief you about the cost of higher education in India with respect to other countries and how Edoofa makes it affordable for students.
133 - 16 Dec 2023 01:22PM - Tushti: The cost of tertiary education in India is much lower than in Western countries. In India, the average cost of Higher Education for international students is around *6000-8000 USD*. 56 - 16 Dec 2023 12:28PM - Tushti: *Bachelor of Commerce (B.com)* is a three year long undergraduate course that is evenly distributed into 6 half-yearly semesters.  A high number of jobs are available for B.com graduates in industries such as Information Technology, Manufacturing, Telecommunications and Banking.The most sought after B.Com. jobs are Financial Manger, Accountant, Lecturer, Chartered Accountant, Human Resource Development etc.  The 3 year B.com degree program aims to facilitate a deep understanding of how business organizations work. It develops knowledge and skills in core B.com subjects like Accounting, Finance, Banking & Insurance, Marketing, Human Resources and Taxation. The entire B.com syllabus is designed in a manner which develops competency in students, allowing them to pursue higher level programs. It also increases practical knowledge and employability.  The subjects included in B.com program are as following:  *Accountancy* *Cost Account* *Statistics* *Management* *Human Resource* *Computer* *Economics* *English* *Law* *Marketing* *Finance*   After being awarded the B.Com degree, candidates can either look for jobs in various departments or opt for higher education.  *B.Com graduates can pursue post-graduation courses such as M.Com (Master of Commerce), MBA (Master of Business Administration), CA (Chartered Accountant), CS (Company Secretary), Actuarial Scientist, and ACCA (Association of Chartered Accountants).*  *B.Com graduates have a plethora of job positions in government as well as private sectors to choose from provided that they are not limited to careers in accounts and finance*

100 - 16 Dec 2023 12:25PM - Tushti: Very well, now let me explain the EWYL Program to you in detail
101 - 16 Dec 2023 12:25PM - Tushti: The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn *scholarship credits* (based on student‚Äôs performance) that is equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing ‚Äì just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies, needs, and tactics.  Promising a better future for its students, and converting an Individual into a Market Ready Professional. Who would have every weapon in their arsenal to conquer the place they shall be landing their foot in.
102 - 16 Dec 2023 12:25PM - Tushti: Moving further now if I have to help you explain properly how the Earn While You Learn Program helps a student, let us take an example wherein we assume the annual fee to be $2200 a year. Now if you manage to earn scholarship credits worth *$100 in a month, this means that you can earn $1200 in a year*, and that would basically bring the cost further down to *$1000 per year which includes the cost of tuition, food and accommodation*, which means for the family monthly cost of the student‚Äôs education would be somewhere between $90-$100 a month.  _*NOTE:- This does not mean that there is any limit up to which a student can earn scholarship credits. In short as much as a student is willing to work hard to sponsor his higher education, he/she can earn accordingly.*_
103 - 16 Dec 2023 12:25PM - Tushti: You would be glad to know about the students who managed to cater for a major part of their remaining annual fee through the Earn While you Learn Program of Edoofa.

133 - 16 Dec 2023 01:18PM - Tushti: You see Edoofa's exceptional program has opened up a world of opportunities for aspiring students, garnering thousands of applications on a daily basis. The Eligibility Evaluation process ensures that deserving candidates are granted the chance to participate in the program. *Once accepted, students are required to pay a nominal Program Fee of $350 within 7 days of receiving their acceptance letter*, following which they commence with their admission process and the esteemed Earn While You Learn Program. Edoofa's mission to provide quality education and support to students is at the heart of this initiative, and we are honored to make a difference in the lives of deserving individuals through this program.
134 - 16 Dec 2023 01:18PM - Tushti: However, as we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days

89 - 16 Dec 2023 12:27PM - Tushti: 1. Robust Education System: India boasts the world's third-largest education system, comprising 1000+ universities and 39,931 colleges. This extensive infrastructure provides students with a diverse range of educational opportunities.  2. Renowned Institutions: India is home to highly rated institutions known for their academic excellence and quality of education. Students can choose from a wide range of disciplines, including politics, philosophy, engineering, medical sciences, biology, business, and media/journalism.  3. Quality Education and Research: Indian universities emphasize a rigorous academic curriculum that combines theoretical knowledge with practical skill development. Students have opportunities for cutting-edge research projects and collaboration with experts.  4. Faculty Expertise: The faculty members in Indian institutions are highly qualified and bring industry expertise to the classroom. 68 - 16 Dec 2023 12:34PM - Tushti: @27635357978 let me explain to you that there are two kinds of programs that provide assistance to the students because a lot of times parents and students themselves misunderstand what a Scholarship actually means.  *1. Scholarships* *2. Sponsorships*  Scholarships make education *affordable* for the students by reducing their *Tuition Fees*, now a lot of times parents and students consider that a Domestic Scholarship would be the same as an International Scholarship, but to understand the difference between them, consider yourself applying for an education in your own country with the help of a scholarship. Now after the scholarship when your tuition fee would be reduced, eventually your entire cost of education would be reduced because being a citizen of the country, you wouldn't be required to spend any fees on Accommodation and feeding separately since in that case, students would be staying with their families. However, if I personally plan to study in Zimbabwe with the same scholarship, I would have to incur some costs on Accommodation and Feeding because I am not a Zimbabwean Citizen. So a lot of times parents and students consider International Scholarship and Domestic Scholarship one and the same thing, but in reality, they aren't.  Sponsorships, on the other hand, take care entirely of a student's education, but because Sponsorships are provided by only a few organizations, there are a lot of terms and conditions which a student might need to follow in order to get the sponsorship, the most common term is that a student after completion of the course would have to work for the organization providing the sponsorship for a period of time.

32 - 16 Dec 2023 12:27PM - Tushti: @263776333898 let me explain to you that there are two kinds of programs that provide assistance to the students because a lot of times parents and students themselves misunderstand what a Scholarship actually means.  *1. Scholarships* *2. Sponsorships*  Scholarships make education *affordable* for the students by reducing their *Tuition Fees*, now a lot of times parents and students consider that a Domestic Scholarship would be the same as an International Scholarship, but to understand the difference between them, consider yourself applying for an education in your own country with the help of a scholarship. Now after the scholarship when your tuition fee would be reduced, eventually your entire cost of education would be reduced because being a citizen of the country, you wouldn't be required to spend any fees on Accommodation and feeding separately since in that case, students would be staying with their families. However, if I personally plan to study in Zimbabwe with the same scholarship, I would have to incur some costs on Accommodation and Feeding because I am not a Zimbabwean Citizen. So a lot of times parents and students consider International Scholarship and Domestic Scholarship one and the same thing, but in reality, they aren't.  Sponsorships, on the other hand, take care entirely of a student's education, but because Sponsorships are provided by only a few organizations, there are a lot of terms and conditions which a student might need to follow in order to get the sponsorship, the most common term is that a student after completion of the course would have to work for the organization providing the sponsorship for a period of time.

39 - 16 Dec 2023 10:45AM - Tushti: A *B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology* is a 3-year undergraduate program that focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work in the field of clinical laboratory science. Medical laboratory technologists play a crucial role in the healthcare system by conducting various laboratory tests and analyses that assist in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases.  During the program, students are trained in various laboratory techniques, sample collection, testing procedures, and result interpretation. They learn how to handle and analyze different types of biological samples, such as blood, urine, tissue, and body fluids. *The curriculum also includes theoretical and practical courses in subjects like microbiology, biochemistry, hematology, immunology, and pathology.*  *Upon completion of the program, graduates can pursue careers as Laboratory Technicians, Laboratory Managers, Medical Officers, Research Associates, Medical Record Technicians, Resident Medical Officers, Lab Assistants, Laboratory Testing Managers, or even pursue teaching positions as Associate Professors or Lecturers in the field of medical laboratory science.*  Job opportunities for medical laboratory technologists can be found in a variety of settings, including hospitals, healthcare clinics, medical pathology laboratories, research laboratories, urologists' offices, and other healthcare facilities. They work closely with healthcare professionals, such as doctors and pathologists, to provide accurate and timely laboratory test results that contribute to patient care and treatment decisions.  *Overall, a B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology provides graduates with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform laboratory tests, contribute to medical research, and make a valuable impact in the field of healthcare.*
